CommentsContent: I really enjoy cooking and, unfortunately, I feel the need to acquire every kitchen gadget that comes down the pike. First, it is very large and takes up a lot of storage space but has a very limited capacity  (I did not realize when I ordered it that there are others that have two cooking surfaces).  When it first arrived, I bought a large package of chicken wings, not realizing that the wings had to be cooked in a single layer not touching each other. So, next attempt was a package of Ore-Ida Super Crispy Steak Fries.  I didn’t feel like getting the air fryer out of storage so I cooked 1/2 of the package in my regular oven according to package directions resulting in perfectly crisp fries.  A few days later I decided that I really had to try out the air fryer so I pulled it out of storage and cooked the other half of the potatoes according to package directions (360-d for 15 min, shaking once).  After 15 minutes it was obvious that the fries were not done.  Tried another 5 min, still not done.  After another 5, they appeared to finally be crisp and they were - at least on the outside. Unfortunately, they were not completely cooked inside.  In MHO, there is nothing that this appliance can do that a regular oven cannot do better.  Even the mid-sized toaster oven that I use on our boat has a larger capacity and does a far better job than this air fryer.  Unfortunately, I tossed the packaging before using it so cannot return.  I will donate it to a worthy organization although I regret having to fob it off on someone else.EDIT:  I was contacted by the company after they read this review -  they were extremely gracious and asked what they could do to make the situation right.  They are a great company and, while air-fryers are not for everyone (me), it is obvious by all the great reviews (on which I based my decision to buy one) that a lot of people love them.  This was, I believe the highest rated air-fryer that I saw and if you are interested in getting one, I definitely recommend doing business with these folks!

CommentsTitle: A Simple, no frills and easy to clean air fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2020
CommentsContent: The Ultrean 4.5 quarter air fryer (Model AF02) is a great air fryer.Key pros:1. Makes great tasting food in a short amount of time. No electrical aftertaste in food even on the initial use of the air fryer. Not sure why I have to say that electrical aftertaste is not a thing, but I have used air fryers in the past where the electrical aftertaste never left the air fryer after 10-15 uses and I just ended up throwing the device out.2. Simple design (air fryers basically do 1 thing, run the air fryer at a certain temperature for a certain amount of time). This air fryer has two knobs, one from temperature and one for time.3. Easy to clean interior cooking/frying surface plate and oil drip basket. The surface plate removes from the basket and easy to clean with soap and a non-abrasive brush due to its non-stick coating. Since the surface plate can be removed, the underlying basket is fully accessible for proper scrubbing unlike many air fryers that tie the surface plate to the basket handle. Since these two pieces are isolated, it doesn't take too much space to leave these to dry after washing.4. Easy to clean exterior. Since there's not like 10 random preset buttons that I would never use, it's super easy to clean.5. Sufficiently long enough cord. It's not too short but it's not super long. The approximate length of the cord is 48-50in (~4ft)6. Not too loud for what it does. You'll definitely hear the fan whirring but you can still have a normal conversation over itSome considerations: (not worth knocking it down a star but worth knowing)1. Temperature and timer knobs are not digital so there is some eyeballing. Most things are forgiving to being 1-3 degrees off and 30s-1min off, but if you are cooking something sensitive to time/temp precision, I recommend using the timer on your phone to help remove one of the variables.2. It has a pretty tall profile. At 13.5in high, it will fit under most cabinets on the kitchen counter but a consideration is that reading the temperature knob might be a little harder for those who are shorter.
